page.title: 14FULFORTH FARM P5
page.content: The brucelosis and T.T testing is done by the vets.The calves are reared and mainly sold as stores. Three markets in the area are used, Hexham (probably most frequently ) but also Tyneside (for fat stock) and Tow Law (for stores). It was difficult to get any idea of a typical day's work as this clearly depends very much upon weather and season.The farmer usually spends the first part of the morning(7.30am - 10.00am) going around and inspecting the stock. Lunch break is from 12.00 to 1.00pm. Again the length of the working day varies depending upon season, weather etc. The most spectacular change in the last 10 years has been the increasing use of sprays ( for everything !!) The son is responsible for this using a big 40 foot boom on the tractor.
